name: NPR
text: Microsoft confirmed that it's discussed its plan to acquire TikTok's U.S. operations with President Trump, just as the White House threatens to blacklist the Chinese-owned app. https://t.co/zc0WvXbdUg

name: NPR
text:
In his plan to address racial inequity, Joe Biden is proposing that the Federal Reserve refocus its attention to America's significant racial economic gaps â€” and make sure the Fed regularly talks about those disparities.
https://t.co/FJmRZa8Vau

name: NPR
text: First Lady Melania Trump is overseeing a "significant renewal" of the White House Rose Garden. Funded by private donations, the project includes making the garden compliant with the Americans with Disabilities Act. https://t.co/S3nz0M2smT

name: NPR
text: Lord & Taylor, the oldest U.S. department store chain, has joined the cascade of retailers tumbling into bankruptcy during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/iU1wCyPSqq

name: NPR
text:
Jeanne Goussev was feeling frustrated with the masculinity in sailing when she was asked if she'd compete in a 750-mile race with an all-women crew. 

"I immediately said, 'Yes.' "

With a time of 6 days 13 hours and 17 minutes, Team Sail Like a Girl won.
 https://t.co/KN5nWKMgN6

name: NPR
text:
After long defending the character of "Black Pete" and even admitting to painting his own face black in the past, the Netherlands' prime minister in June  said societal pressure would soon force the character to retire.
 https://t.co/d5Z6KzJKbM

name: NPR
text:
One RV rental site says bookings are triple what they were last summer. Plus, with gas prices down, it's more affordable than it's been in years.
https://t.co/yZJP7WxgMt

name: NPR
text:
Think of a famous living American whose first and last names have a total of 8 letters â€” all different. 5 of these letters are consecutive in the alphabet. The remaining 3 can be rearranged to spell a woman's nickname. 

Submit your answer here ðŸ‘‡
https://t.co/mHSBEkZYYb

name: NPR
text: Citing a concern for the First Nations communities where boaters stop for food and fuel, a maritime posse of Canadian retirees is tracking American yachts sneaking across the border despite the shutdown. https://t.co/hqSKKWqDW0

name: NPR
text: More than 60 Confederate monuments have come down around the country, but hundreds remain, many of them in small Southern towns. In Marshall, Texas, the statue at the center of town has sparked some self-reflection -- and an emotional debate over its fate. https://t.co/SZ8GGiJVaE

name: NPR
text:
On the Hill this week:
â€¢ Contentious coronavirus relief bill negotiations
â€¢ Testimony from former deputy AG Sally Yates on Michael Flynn
At the polls: 
â€¢ Primaries in six states, including a key U.S. Senate race in Kansas
Coming soon:
â€¢ Biden's VP pick
https://t.co/W2Z59QviE9

name: NPR
text:
California Rep. Karen Bass isn't a household name, but she took the lead on Democrats' police reform bill this year, earning her a lot of fans among Democrats on Capitol Hill. 

It may also have landed her on the short list to be Joe Biden's running mate. 
https://t.co/oMutCGysTR

name: NPR
text:
In an emotional video, federal judge Esther Salas pleads for better protection for her colleagues on the bench, saying "my son's death cannot be in vain." Daniel Anderl, 20, was shot and killed at the door of the family home by an "anti-feminist" laywer.
https://t.co/aVU6ObGDkX

name: NPR
text:
It may be hard to believe President Trump could dig an even deeper electoral hole for himself, but he has. 

Polling now shows Florida and Pennsylvania leaning Democrat Joe Biden's way, and Georgia as a toss-up. https://t.co/lVydWXweKP

name: NPR
text:
Tailored Brands, parent of Men's Wearhouse and Jos. A. Bank, was struggling with debt and flagging demand before the pandemic. Then most office closed, and everyone stopped buying work clothes. 

It's the latest major retailer to file for bankruptcy. 
https://t.co/S9vQm5U5kc

name: NPR
text:
COVID-19 has made things more expensive while causing many governmentsâ€™ revenues to nosedive. Florida's governor compared his stateâ€™s budget cuts to the Red Wedding. 

See how bad the situation is in your state: https://t.co/iTLQOA0SiJ

name: NPR
text: NPRâ€™s latest analysis of the Electoral College map shows former Vice President Joe Bidenâ€™s advantage over President Trump continues to grow. NPRâ€™s Domenico Montanaro and Asma Khalid explain. More: https://t.co/yvCIOlY5PJ https://t.co/qEA84Bv8O9

name: NPR
text:
John Legend's four Tiny Desk Home Concert songs were all written before the pandemic, but may be more necessary now, he says. 

" 'Bigger Love' is about the power of love to get us through tough times. ... And we all need a little dance break, too, right?" https://t.co/PWqAe86AZM

name: NPR
text:
The Navy is investigating footage showing a man wearing a Colin Kaepernick jersey being attacked by dogs during a K-9 demonstration.

The man is heard making a joke about standing â€” eliciting laughter from a crowd of onlookers.
https://t.co/S6nSERzd1d

name: NPR
text: A dozen U.S. legislators have caught the new coronavirus, and dozens more have self-quarantined as a result of exposure to it. By late July at least 85 Capitol workers had reported a positive test or were presumed to be infected. https://t.co/UjapumoMn6

name: NPR
text:
WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says that while some COVID-19 vaccine candidates are in advanced clinical trials, the world must remain reliant on "the basics" of disease control. 
https://t.co/su6kHJ9vrm

name: NPR
text:
Tropical Storm Isaias is expected to make landfall as a hurricane in the Carolinas on Monday, before swirling up the Mid-Atlantic coast.

The National Hurricane Center is warning residents to brace for flash flooding and possible tornadoes.
https://t.co/6Lba72PoRu
